settings.title: Where exactly does bronzer go?
settings.text_center: Bronzer is meant to add warmth and dimension to the face, but the best bronzer placement depends on the specific effect you wish to achieve. Keep scrolling for Fong’s expert intel.

settings.title: The Best Skincare Routine Order, According to Skin Experts
For the sunkissed look
settings.desc: “Apply bronzer to the areas of your face where the sun would naturally tan, such as the tip of the nose, forehead and high points of your cheeks,” Fong says. Skip bronzer on the forehead if your face is on the smaller side.

settings.title: For the overall bronzed look
settings.desc: Fong recommends using a large bronzer brush to sweep the product across your face. Apply it lightly to avoid adding too much product.

settings.title: For the more contoured look
settings.desc:
Apply bronzer to the hollows of your cheeks or under the apples of your cheeks, just under the jawline, under the brow (with a smaller brush) and on your temples, Fong says. If you use a bronzer in lieu of traditional contour(which is normally matte), she recommends using one without shimmer.

To use bronzer to contour the nose, Fong recommends using a flat brush with a bronzer without shimmer. Apply the bronzer along the sides of the nose and a bit on the tip. If you have a natural curve on the bridge of the nose, you can also apply bronzer there.

settings.quotes: “Apply bronzer to the areas of your face where the sun would naturally tan...”

settings.title: Customize your application
settings.desc:
How you apply bronzer also affects the finished look, and the application technique differs depending on the type of bronzer formula. Fong recommends using an angled powder brush for a liquid bronzer; remember that a little can go a long way. For cream bronzer, use an angled brush or makeup sponge, or better yet, your fingertips, which also help bring the product to your body temperature, making it much easier to blend.

For powder bronzer, use either a large bronzer brush or an angled powder brush. Just be sure to tap off excess product before applying it to the face (it’s easier to build the color than remove it if you over-apply). Use a light hand to apply the bronzer and grab a clean brush to blend it out without the bronzer using light strokes. Ensure that it is well blended so it looks natural, without any lines of demarcation.

settings.title: Add bronzer to the neck
settings.desc:
How you apply bronzer also affects the finished look, and the application technique differs depending on the type of bronzer formula. Fong recommends using an angled powder brush for a liquid bronzer; remember that a little can go a long way. For cream bronzer, use an angled brush or makeup sponge, or better yet, your fingertips, which also help bring the product to your body temperature, making it much easier to blend.

For powder bronzer, use either a large bronzer brush or an angled powder brush. Just be sure to tap off excess product before applying it to the face (it’s easier to build the color than remove it if you over-apply). Use a light hand to apply the bronzer and grab a clean brush to blend it out without the bronzer using light strokes. Ensure that it is well blended so it looks natural, without any lines of demarcation.

settings.quotes: “I mix moisturizer in my hand with the bronzer and blend the neck with my hands or a brush.”

settings.title: How to apply bronzer
settings.desc:
How you apply bronzer also affects the finished look, and the application technique differs depending on the type of bronzer formula. Fong recommends using an angled powder brush for a liquid bronzer; remember that a little can go a long way. For cream bronzer, use an angled brush or makeup sponge, or better yet, your fingertips, which also help bring the product to your body temperature, making it much easier to blend.

 

For powder bronzer, use either a large bronzer brush or an angled powder brush. Just be sure to tap off excess product before applying it to the face (it’s easier to build the color than remove it if you over-apply). Use a light hand to apply the bronzer and grab a clean brush to blend it out without the bronzer using light strokes. Ensure that it is well blended so it looks natural, without any lines of demarcation.

settings.title: Use bronzer as eyeshadow
settings.desc: Bronzer isn’t just for the face, says Fong, who explains it can also double as eyeshadow. Her suggestion: Apply it as a crease eyeshadow, giving a very natural and effortless look that adds warmth to the face. This technique is excellent when you don’t have much time to get ready, but still want to add some oomph to the eyes.

settings.title: Add bronzer to the neck
settings.desc: Your face can be perfectly bronzed, but if it doesn’t match your neck, the overall look of your complexion is compromised. This is why Fong emphasizes the importance of blending the bronzer into the neck. Here’s how: “I mix moisturizer in my hand with the bronzer and blend the neck with my hands or a brush,” she says. “This helps me not go overboard but still create a seamless look with the bronzer on the face.”
